Adele,

Sorry for the confusion, I thought you were trying to find=A0more C=
++
NEAT examples. I'm afraid I'm a lowly C/C++ coder, and don't know
anythi=
ng really about C#. I believe the SharpNEAT C# version is one of
the more p=
olished NEAT libraries.

There's a 3 part tutorial using the C# version sta=
rting here that might help:
http://www.nashcoding.com/2010/07/17/tutorial-e=
volving-neural-networks-with-sharpneat-2-part-1/

That might help a bit. If=
 you have problems with going through the C#
code, the python version might=
 help. From what I understand, python is
a very intuitive language. I'm not=
 sure if they've released any code
yet. There's also the Java version.

Sor=
ry I wasn't more help. Good luck!

-Drew

On Wed, Dec 7, 2011 at 2:44 AM, a=
deleh ebrahimi <adlh_ebrahimi@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> Drew,
> Thank you!
=
>
> I chose Mr. Bookland book just because of its easy and simple codes, bu=
t I am working in the area of =A0"Games", and I think Bookland implementati=
on is =A0not a proper choice.
> =A0I want to implement my project with =A0a=
 Visual Programming language, maybe "C#"!, but As I said I do not have enou=
gh experience in C# and I could not understand some of C# codes of NEAT imp=
lementation. So I need a simple example.
>
> Adele
>
> ____________________=
____________
> From: Drew Kirkpatrick <drew.kirkpatrick@...>
> To: ne=
at@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Tuesday, December 6, 2011 6:22 PM
> Subject: Re:=
 [neat] NEAT for beginners
>
>
> Adele,
>
> I also started off from Mat Buc=
kland's book, and have been working with a modified version of his implemen=
tation. If you're particular about sticking with his implementation and C++=
 (his is a relatively simple implementation of NEAT from what I understand)=
 I can send you my code if you want (buggy work in progress).
>
> It's not =
a simple example at all (competitive coevolution), but it would give you so=
me code examples and bug fixes to Mat Buckland's original implementation (m=
ine is a Linux port). Probably only useful to you for looking at the change=
s I made to Mr. Buckland's code, but that would be easy as most of the code=
 is the same, and the classes retained their names from those described in =
his book.
>
> You might want to start with getting his minesweeper (was tha=
t it?) example application running, and try putting in some of the bug fixe=
s folks have recommended in his implementation (I think I can help find tho=
se). Once you have that working, you might want to try the XOR test, and pe=
rhaps pole balancing. I believe those are common tasks to undertake.
>
> Le=
t me know if you want any code, or have any questions I might be able to he=
lp with. I'm afraid I'm far from a NEAT guru, but I don't think too many fo=
lks are working with Mat Buckland's implementation now. I think that's a gr=
eat book, and that chapter helped me considerably in getting started workin=
g with NEAT.
>
>
> -Drew
>
> On Tue, Dec 6, 2011 at 2:01 AM, adeleh ebrahim=
i <adlh_ebrahimi@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi everybody
> I am new in learnin=
g NEAT. I studied Mr. Stanley paper, =A0titled "evolving Neural Networks th=
rough Augmenting Topologies" and
> Now, I am studying last chapter of Mr. B=
uckland book - "AI techniques for Game Programming".
>
> But I need to know=
 more about NEAT implementation with an example. Is it possible to introduc=
e me a proper and simple example with its tutorial. Unfortunately I don`t h=
ave enough experience in C#.
>
> Sincerely
> Adele
